intro: Chaerophyllum temuloides var. trapezutinum, commonly known as the Balkan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical structure and habitat preferences make it an important species for ecological studies in its native region.
